question.question-text: It is indicated in paragraph 2 that cocoa trees are native to
question.explain-text: The passage states that cocoa trees are indigenous to South America's river valleys. This means that cocoa trees are native to South America. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is mentioned in paragraph 2 that all of the following were involved in the cultivation of cocoa trees by the seventh century EXCEPT
question.explain-text: The passage states that by the seventh century, the Mayans had brought the trees north into Mexico, and numerous other cultures including the Aztecs and the Toltecs seem to have been involved in the production of cocoa trees. This means that the Mayans in the first answer, the Aztecs in the second answer, and the Toltecs in the third answer were involved in the cultivation of cocoa trees. All of the answers EXCEPT the last one are mentioned in paragraph 2. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is NOT stated in paragraph 2 that cacahuatl was
question.explain-text: The passage mentions a special drink, cacahuatl, which was made…with red pepper and states that it was so bitter. This means that cacahuatl was a special drink in paragraph 2, rather spicy in the third answer, and rather bitter in the last answer. The first answer is the one that is NOT stated and is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: What is NOT listed in paragraph 3 as an ingredient in the paste developed by the Spanish?
question.explain-text: The passage states that they created a paste by heating a mixture of ground sugar, cinnamon, cloves, anise, almonds, hazelnuts, vanilla, dried cocoa beans, and orange-flavored water. The ground sugar is a sweetener in the first answer; the cinnamon, cloves, and anise are spices in the second answer; and almonds and hazelnuts are nuts in the third answer. The last answer is the one that is NOT listed and is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is indicated in paragraph 3 that chocolatl

answer-list.answer-text: was a slab of hardened paste

question.explain-text: The passage states that they prepared a drink, which they called chocolatl, by dissolving pieces of the hardened paste into hot water or broth. This means that chocolatl was a hot beverage. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is stated in paragraph 4 that

answer-list.answer-text: chocolate appeared in England before it appeared in Spain
chocolate candies were quite popular in London in the 1600s

answer-text.exp: coffeehouses were popular in London before chocolate houses were

answer-list.answer-text: by the sixteenth century it was popular to dissolve chocolate in milk

question.explain-text: The passage mentions chocolate houses, which were fashionable versions of the coffeehouses that had sprung up in London in the 1600s. From this, it can be determined that coffeehouses were popular in London before chocolate houses were. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: According to paragraph 5, it is NOT true that van Houten's invention was used to

answer-text.exp: mix cocoa butter and cocoa beans

answer-list.answer-text: separate cocoa powder from cocoa beans
remove cocoa butter from cocoa beans

question.explain-text: The passage states that Conrad van Houten invented a press that would squeeze much of the cocoa butter out of cocoa beans. This means that it is NOT true that van Houten's invention was used to mix cocoa butter and cocoa beans. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which of the following is true, according to paragraph 5?

answer-list.answer-text: It was easier to blend cocoa powder with sugar than it was to blend cocoa butter with sugar.
Better candies could be prepared using cocoa powder rather than cocoa butter.
Adding cocoa butter to drinks made the drinks smoother and tastier.

answer-text.exp: Better drinks could be prepared using cocoa powder rather than cocoa butter.

question.explain-text: The passage states that it was possible to create a much smoother and tastier drink by blending cocoa powder without the cocoa butter into hot liquids. This means that better drinks could be prepared using cocoa powder rather than cocoa butter. The last answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: What 1870s innovation by Swiss candy makers is discussed in paragraph 5?

answer-text.exp: The addition of dried milk to chocolate

answer-list.answer-text: The use of paste in the production of chocolate
The addition of whole milk to chocolate

question.explain-text: The passage states that in the 1870s, Swiss candy makers improved chocolate production by adding the dried milk…to chocolate to make solid milk chocolate. This means that the 1870s innovation by Swiss candy makers discussed in paragraph 5 is the addition of dried milk to chocolate. The second answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: According to paragraph 6, what factor limited the widespread enjoyment of chocolate in the period before the end of the nineteenth century?
question.explain-text: The passage states that by the end of the nineteenth century, chocolate…was not widely enjoyed because of its prohibitive price. This means that the factor that limited the widespread enjoyment of chocolate in the period before the end of the nineteenth century was its high price. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: According to paragraph 6, Hershey's caramel company
question.explain-text: The passage states that Hershey was operating the successful Lancaster Caramel Company. This means that Hershey's caramel company was not located in Hershey. The first answer is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: It is NOT mentioned in paragraph 6 that Hershey wanted to

answer-list.answer-text: create an exclusive brand of chocolate

answer-text.exp: make his chocolate available at a low price

question.explain-text: The passage states that he also decided to use mass production techniques to create large quantities of individually wrapped and affordable chocolates for the public. This means that Hershey wanted to mass-produce chocolate in the first answer, to sell chocolate in individual servings in the second answer, and to make his chocolate available at a low price in the last answer. The third answer is the one that is NOT mentioned and is therefore the best answer to this question.

question.question-text: Which of the following is true, according to paragraph 6?

answer-list.answer-text: Hershey built his new chocolate factory in Lancaster.
The original "Hershey Bar" was first produced in Hershey, Pennsylvania.

answer-text.exp: The name of the town where the new factory was located changed its name.

answer-list.answer-text: The new factory in Hershey produced caramels as well as chocolates.

question.explain-text: The passage states that he began building a new factory in Derry Church, Pennsylvania and that by 1906 the community had been renamed Hershey. This means that the name of the town where the new factory was located changed its name. The third answer is therefore the best answer to this question.
